edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.dhExtended

Class SigmaDHExtendedProverComputation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.dhExtended.SigmaDHExtendedProverComputation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DlogBasedSigma, SigmaProverComputation

    public class SigmaDHExtendedProverComputation
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaProverComputation, DlogBasedSigma
    Concrete implementation of Sigma Protocol prover computation.

    This protocol is used for a prover to convince a verifier that the input tuple (g1,...,gm,h1,...,hm) is an extended Diffie-Hellman tuple, meaning that there exists a single w in Zq such that hi=gi^w for all i.

    The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 1.3 of pseudo codes document at http://cryptobiu.github.io/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode.pdf.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      • computeFirstMsg

        public SigmaProtocolMsg computeFirstMsg(SigmaProverInput input)
        Computes the first message of the protocol.

        "SAMPLE a random r in Zq

        COMPUTE ai = gi^r for all i".

        Specified by:
        computeFirstMsg in interface SigmaProverComputation
        Parameters:
        input - MUST be an instance of SigmaDHExtendedProverInput.
        Returns:
        the computed message
        Throws:
